p: The first task in implementing a risk assessment framework is to choose crop and climate models to work with. Climate model ensembles are usually chosen by the impacts community based on availability and so are to a large extent ensemble of opportunity. Similarly, crop modelling groups may have in-house crop models that they favour, often for good reasons such as confidence in their sound use of the model. However, explicit justification of model choice is often missing: White et al. (2011) found that only 18% of 221 studies reviewed thoroughly justified their choice of crop model.
